intro: Sida javensis, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Sida javensis is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments.
